content.description: Climb through the steep first section making long reaches to big jugs. After the second bolt, trend slightly left to un-bolted but easy fifth class moves (a hand/fist sized piece cuts the run out and keeps you out of ground fall territory). Rest up and tackle the final steep headwall to the rings. Deserves more traffic.
content.protection: 5 bolts and an optional hand/fist sized piece
content.location: Starts just right and slightly up from Home Again. Roughly the middle of the bog wall.
Start in corner system up banded schist to anchor

climbs.name: Ride the Monkey
climbs.fa: Travis Peckham, Nancy Koenig Peckham, Bill Jenks 1995

content.description: Chimney, offset flaring crack squeeze. Dirty. Wet. a 4" will fit. It weird, climb it.
content.location: Go to the far end of the bog wall and find the detached flake thing.

content.description: Climb the face passing 5 bolts. Skip the first anchor if you intend on continuing up the extension.
Climb the arete and face above the anchor. It’s rad.
content.protection: 5 bolts and a two point bolted anchor with quick links and rings
content.location: Above Cattail and The Moss Boss

content.description: Old start in mossy corner. New bolts (3). On clean face rising to crack. Follow crack to high anchor above bulge.
content.location: left side of clean face in crack

content.description: Follow the left leaning flake system until it runs out, then move up to the chains.
content.location: Walk up the hill from the kermit/home again main area past an exfoliating chossy section of cliff. This is the farthest right route at Bog and is next to an obvious chimney/OW.

content.description: Climb clean face through interesting back and forth movement. Step left into crack and climb to 2 bolt anchor. Var. 1 (5.10) not bolted, pull bulge instead of stepping left, better to do on TR as face is clean and unprotected fall will put you at a 15+ foot fall.
content.location: right of mossy corner. second bolted line.

climbs.name: Corner cookies
climbs.fa: G. Turner with C. Orton and M. Finno 2020

content.description: corner of crumbles to left of Jugalicious (5.8+), some small micros in busted rock leads to a nice seam 15 ft high, stick to the left side of the Jugalicious face without moving right. Safer to do on TR after climbing Jugalicious
content.protection: PG13. low is not protected physically, 2 bolt anchor at top
content.location: Walk to the Bog wall. stare at Jugalicious. Look left and find the pile of choss awaiting your chalk sweaty skin...

content.description: Climb the crack and obvious feature. The crux is the first few moves off the ground (5.7ish). Mostly 5.5 climbing.
content.protection: Gear. 2 point bolted anchor and chains

content.description: First moves crux starting left of Stylee. Lay back without using pinch on face of wall or use left side pull. Heel hook lower flake and pull high to slabby jug. Side pull and follow arete of schist system to horns.

climbs.name: Betula alleghaniensis
climbs.fa: G. Turner, C. Orton, D. Quigley 9/2021

content.description: Start on the right leaning vegetated crack. Traverse across the face, past Home Again (5.8+), original FA does not use these bolts, but places pro in crack. Circumnavigate the birch into a large flake/ramp to the upper wall of Shady Grove (5.8+). Use this bolt line to 2 bolt anchor. Ending is pumpy. Protection is PG13 with a finesse between extending draws to cut drag and taking large swinging ground falls. Do not clear any vegetation, no vegetation was removed from crack on FA, keep it that way. Caution, there is a hemlock tree that can impale you below the birch tree, dont fall here.
content.protection: SIngle rack with micros. PG13. 3 bolts. 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: There was a day when mountain project descriptions were pretty much like interpretive dance. For today, go to the Bog Wall.

content.description: Climb the crack 5.7ish making a tricky move off the ground to gain the ledge above. Stick clip the first bolt or boulder up and clip it. Or bring a #3 if you want protection down low. 7 bolts and rap rings above.
Why hasnt this wall been posted? West facing shaded wall in Camels Hump Forest east of Long Trail parking. Find herd path. Use guide book.
